meanings.definition: A general statement or concept obtained by inference from specific cases.
meanings.sent1: The generalisation that all birds can fly is not always true.
meanings.sent2: In science class, we learned about the generalisation of gravity pulling objects towards the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The generalisation that all cats hate water is proven wrong by my cat who loves swimming.
meanings.sent4: Her generalisation that all people from the city are rude was shattered when she met kind strangers.
meanings.sent5: The generalisation that all snakes are dangerous helps us stay cautious in the wild.

meanings.definition: The action or process of making general or broad statements.
meanings.sent1: His generalisation about the benefits of exercise motivated me to start working out.
meanings.sent2: The generalisation of 'practice makes perfect' is often true in many situations.
meanings.sent3: The generalisation that eating carrots improves eyesight led to a funny incident when I tried to see in the dark.
meanings.sent4: The generalisation that laughter is the best medicine is a reminder to find joy in every situation.
meanings.sent5: The generalisation that honesty is the best policy guides my decisions in life.
